ai-tha-ap85:1.1_0: “Sit down at the root of a tree,
ai-tha-ap85:1.4_0: “In the wilderness, I’m sitting in the wilderness,
ai-tha-ap85:2.1_0: who is compassionate, out of compassion (for us).
ai-tha-ap85:2.2_0: The Teacher, having given me three,
ai-tha-ap85:2.4_0: Having raised my joined palms to him,
ai-tha-ap85:3.4_0: with the passing away I have died there,
ai-tha-ap85:4.1_0: On the two occasions when the other goes forth
ai-tha-ap85:4.2_0: When I worship the supreme among men
ai-tha-ap85:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap85:5.2_0: a big crowd of five hundred logs.
ai-tha-ap85:7.1_0: That is how these verses were lying down while the senior venerable rose from his seat.
ai-tha-ap85:8.1_0: Third: the third Elder Nun Sītaka
